definitions: casual talk about other people's private affairs
person who enjoys talking about others
examples: Office gossip spread quickly about the merger
She refused to listen to malicious gossip
The neighborhood gossip knew everyone's business
Don't be such a gossip about their problems

definitions: chisel with curved blade for cutting grooves
groove or hole made by gouging
examples: The carpenter used a gouge for decorative work
Wood gouges come in various sizes
A deep gouge marred the table surface
The accident left gouges in the pavement

definitions: fruit with hard shell used as container or decoration
examples: Native Americans used gourds as water vessels
Decorative gourds brightened the autumn display
She carved patterns into the dried gourd
Bottle gourds make excellent birdhouses

definitions: connoisseur of fine food and drink
examples: The gourmet recommended the chef's special
Only a true gourmet would appreciate this wine
Gourmet cooking classes filled quickly
The gourmet food store sold rare ingredients

definitions: painful inflammation of joints caused by excess uric acid
examples: His gout flared up after eating rich foods
Gout commonly affects the big toe
Medieval kings often suffered from gout
Diet changes can help manage gout symptoms

definitions: system or method of governing or management
examples: Corporate governance ensures ethical business practices
The country struggled with democratic governance
Good governance requires transparency and accountability
University governance involves multiple stakeholders

definitions: the activity or process of governing a country or organization
examples: Governing a diverse nation requires compromise
The governing of the colony proved challenging

The governing process involves many decisions

definitions: position or period of being a governor
examples: She announced her candidacy for governorship
His governorship lasted two terms
The governorship came with significant responsibilities
During his governorship, education improved

definitions: woman's long formal dress
loose robe worn by professionals or patients
examples: She wore an elegant gown to the gala
The bride's gown had intricate beading
The surgeon put on a sterile gown
Graduation gowns were distributed to students

definitions: informal term for graduate or graduation
examples: The grad student defended her thesis
New grads flooded the job market
Grad school requires dedication and focus
She's a recent grad from Harvard

definitions: scale or series of successive changes, stages, or degrees
examples: The paint showed subtle gradations of blue
Social gradations were clearly defined
Color gradations created a sunset effect
The gradation from light to dark was smooth

definitions: machine for leveling ground or roads
person who grades or student in a specific grade
examples: The road grader smoothed the dirt road

Third graders learned multiplication tables

definitions: degree of steepness of a slope; rate of change
examples: The road's gradient made cycling difficult

definitions: process of assigning grades or levels
examples: Grading papers took all weekend
The grading system uses letter grades

Road grading improved drainage

definitions: writing or drawings on walls in public places
examples: Graffiti covered the subway walls
Some consider graffiti an art form
The city removed graffiti from buildings
Ancient graffiti provides historical insights

definitions: tissue surgically transplanted from one part to another
illegal use of position for personal gain
examples: The skin graft healed successfully
Bone graft surgery repaired the fracture
Political graft undermined public trust
The mayor was convicted of graft

definitions: process of joining plant parts or transplanting tissue
examples: Grafting produced disease-resistant fruit trees
The grafting technique required precision
Skin grafting helped burn victims heal
Rose grafting created new varieties

definitions: whole wheat flour or items made from it
examples: Graham crackers make great s'mores
She baked bread with graham flour
The recipe called for graham cracker crust
Graham flour adds nutty flavor

definitions: legendary cup used by Jesus at the Last Supper
thing that is eagerly pursued or sought after
examples: Knights searched for the Holy Grail
The Grail legend inspired many stories
Finding a cure became his holy grail
The startup's grail was market dominance

definitions: rules governing the structure and use of a language
examples: English grammar can be complex

Latin grammar influenced many languages

definitions: person who studies or is expert in grammar
examples: The grammarian explained the rule clearly

As a grammarian, she loved language patterns
The grammarian wrote style guides

definitions: early record player using flat discs
examples: The antique gramophone still worked perfectly
His gramophone collection was valuable
Music from the gramophone filled the room
The gramophone revolutionized home entertainment

definitions: informal term for grandmother
examples: Gran always made the best cookies
We visit Gran every Sunday
My gran taught me to knit
Gran lived through two world wars

definitions: building for storing threshed grain
examples: The old granary stored the harvest
Mice invaded the farm's granary
Stone granaries lasted for centuries
The granary protected grain from weather

definitions: informal term for grandfather
examples: Grandad told stories about his youth
My grandad served in the navy
Grandad's workshop was full of tools
We helped grandad in the garden

definitions: child of one's son or daughter
examples: Their first grandchild arrived last month
Grandparents spoil their grandchildren
Each grandchild received a special gift
She had twelve grandchildren

definitions: daughter of one's son or daughter
examples: His granddaughter graduated with honors
The granddaughter inherited her talent

Their granddaughter visited every summer

definitions: splendor and impressiveness, especially of appearance or style
examples: The mountain's grandeur took their breath away

They restored the theater to its grandeur

definitions: highest title a chess player can achieve
examples: The grandmaster won in twenty moves

He studied grandmaster games

definitions: son of one's nephew or niece

definitions: daughter of one's nephew or niece
examples: My grandniece started kindergarten

definitions: informal term for grandfather
examples: Grandpa taught me to fish

Grandpa's stories entertained everyone

definitions: parent of one's father or mother
examples: Grandparents often spoil their grandchildren

definitions: son of one's son or daughter
examples: Their grandson plays college football
The grandson carried on the family business

Each grandson received equal inheritance

definitions: main seating area at a sports ground or racetrack
examples: The grandstand offered excellent views
Fans filled the grandstand for the derby

definitions: brother of one's grandparent
examples: My granduncle fought in World War II

definitions: very hard igneous rock used in construction
examples: The granite countertops were durable

definitions: informal term for grandmother
examples: Granny's apple pie won the contest
We spent summers at granny's house

definitions: scale or level of detail in a set of data
examples: Data granularity affects analysis accuracy

definitions: small compact particle of a substance
examples: Coffee granules dissolved in hot water

definitions: small round fruit growing in clusters on vines
examples: Purple grapes hung from the vine

definitions: large round citrus fruit with yellow skin and bitter taste
examples: Pink grapefruit has sweeter flavor

definitions: soft black carbon used in pencils and as lubricant
examples: Pencil leads contain graphite not lead

examples: The wrestlers locked in a grapple

definitions: fighting technique involving holds and throws
examples: Grappling requires strength and technique

definitions: plant-eating insect with long hind legs for jumping
examples: A grasshopper landed on the leaf

Children caught grasshoppers in jars

definitions: large open area covered with grass
examples: Cattle grazed on the grassland
African grasslands support diverse wildlife
The grassland stretched to the horizon
Fire helps maintain healthy grasslands
